page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There is very little employment in the village itself and most people have to travel to the nearest towns for work. The main source of employment in the area is on the many farms that cover our D-block, there are a few shops in the village and there is also a car and machinery repair yard near the station. Some people commute to London each day from the village and the school employs six local people as helpers. There is little new work or housing in the village and so the population remains quite stable and young people are finding it increasingly difficult to find work. There is already some unemployment in the village and people have to be prepared to travel further afield to find jobs.
